boat.name: Rigmor von Gluckstadt
boat.full_description:
Built as 'Zollkreuzer no.5' (customs cruiser) by Johann Paul Schroeder in 1853, she was seized by the Prussians and decommissioned in 1864. Re-named Treue (Fidelity) in 1874 by her new owner G J Matzen, she became a 'Austerntransport' (cargo vessel) before being sold to a Danish owner. Once more re-named, Manna, she was used as a 'Frachtschiff' (cargo ship) for many years. Following several changes of ownership, she was converted in 1917, under the new name Rigmor, to a 'Steinfischer' (stone fisher).

During the 1980s, having been sold as a leisure sailing craft when she was no longer viable for dredging, Rigmor began to deteriorate. A group was established to buy and restore the ship, returning her to Gluckstadt in 1992. For more information, visit her website.
boat.short_description: The Rigmor von Gluckstadt is the oldest seaworthy sailing ship in Germany, originally built as a customs cutter in 1853 she is now a museum ship based on the River Elbe.
